lead_paragraph: The Unocal Corporation said yesterday that it had won a court case over a gasoline patent that could provide licensing fees for the oil company and higher fuel prices for California drivers. The Federal District Court in Los Angeles ruled against six major oil companies that had challenged a patent Unocal has on a clean-burning type of gasoline that California requires. Unocal won the patent in 1994 and wants to collect a fee for every gallon sold. The patent was challenged by ARCO, the Chevron Corporation, the Exxon Corporation, the Mobil Corporation, the Shell Oil unit of the Royal Dutch/Shell Group and Texaco Inc. Neither damages nor royalty fees were set.
abstract: Unocal Corp wins court case over gasoline patent that could provide licensing fees for oil company and higher fuel prices for California drivers; Federal District Court in Los Angeles rules against six major oil companies that had challenged patent Unocal has on clean-burning type of gasoline that California requires (S)

headline.main: UNOCAL WINS GASOLINE PATENT SUIT IN CALIFORNIA
